newsitem.title: USA: NYC Mayor fiscal plan seen reducing out-year gaps.
newsitem.headline: NYC Mayor fiscal plan seen reducing out-year gaps.

text.p: New York City Mayor Rudolph Guiliani, who expects the city to take in a record surplus in fiscal year 1997, has narrowed, but not closed, huge out-year gaps, according to budget documents.
The mayor plans to unveil his proposed fiscal year 1998 budget at City Hall Thurdsay morning.
The fiscal 1999 budget now projects about a $2.005 billion gap, down by about $379 million.
The fiscal 2000 gap narrows by about $389 million to $2.885 billion, while the fiscal 2001 gap narrows by about $361 million to $2.71 billion.
The city's fiscal year begins July 1.
